titleStmt.title: Moravian Lives Personography
titleStmt.principal:
Katherine Mary Faull, Principal Investigator Bucknell University
Lewisburg, Pennsylvania
faull@bucknell.edu

Christer Ahlberger, Principal Investigator, 2015-2018 University of Gothenburg
Gothenburg, Sweden
christer.ahlberger@history.gu.se

sourceDesc.p: List of Moravian Lives person entities with reference to persistent identifiers, using ML standard names

revisionDesc.change: Updated responsibility list, added more names and fields

event.desc: received congregation Yorkshire in Fulneck 25.03.1751 (OS) / 05.04.1751 (NS), new sisters’ house Fulneck 15.12.1752, sacrament Yorkshire in Fulneck 25.02.1753 d 25.12.1754 aged 20 sisters’ house Fulneck, interred Fulneck by Br G Traneker 28.12.1754 grave 75 - 1st section, 2nd row, 8th grave from path

person.note: (LW/G/F)CBssALLOT, Mary (1734-1754) b 12.08.1734 Rastrick Parish of Halifax reception: baptized Church of England, received society/sisters’ house Cleckheaton May 1746, sisters’ house Tyersal 1750, received congregation Yorkshire in Fulneck 25.03.1751 (OS) / 05.04.1751 (NS), new sisters’ house Fulneck 15.12.1752, sacrament Yorkshire in Fulneck 25.02.1753 d 25.12.1754 aged 20 sisters’ house Fulneck, interred Fulneck by Br G Traneker 28.12.1754 grave 75 - 1st section, 2nd row, 8th grave from path

event.desc: St Peter's Church Hartshead 11 August, 1740 22 August, 1740

person.note: (W/F/G)ASHLEY, Hannah (1740-1761) b 09.08.1740 (OS) / 20.08.1740 (NS) Hartshead educated: girls’ school Row Head 1748 resided: Hartshead 1740-1758 reception: baptized St Peter’s Church Hartshead 11.08.1740 (OS) / 22.08.1740 (NS), received society Mirfield 1752, received congregation Fulneck 13.11.1756, sisters’ house Gomersal 01.07.1758, sisters’ house Fulneck 02.02.1759, sacrament Fulneck 28.11.1759 family: daughter of John Ashley (b 1712) and Martha (née Keighley) (b 1711), sister of Mary (Southwell) (b 1734), Martha (b 1737), Joshua (b 1744), Sarah (b 1745), Betty (b 1747) and Benigna (b 1749) d 05.05.1761 aged 20, interred Fulneck by Br B La Trobe 07.05.1761 grave 188 - 1st section, 6th row, 3rd grave from path

(LW/W/P/F)=#BENTLEY, Abigail (1722-1766) b 23.09.1722 Wyke Parish of Birstall reception: baptized Church of England, Ingham’s society Wyke, received society Norwood Green 1742, transferred society Mirfield 1748, transferred society Holme 1752, received congregation Yorkshire in Fulneck 13.11.1752, new sisters’ house Fulneck 15.12.1752, sacrament Yorkshire in Fulneck 27.01.1754, founder member Fulneck congregation 19.04.1755 d 07.12.1766 aged 44 sisters’ house Fulneck, interred Fulneck by Br B La Trobe 10.12.1766 grave 307 - 1st section, 11th row, 7th grave from path

(W/G/F)£^BRADLEY, Rachel (1742-1809) b 04.10.1742 (OS) / 15.10.1742 (NS) Golcar Parish of Huddersfield occupation: sewer resided: Golcar 1735 - 1758 reception: baptized Church of England, sisters’ house Gomersal 21.05.1758, sisters’ house Fulneck 11.11.1758, received congregation Fulneck 13.11.1759, sacrament Fulneck 13.08.1767, returned sisters’ house Gomersal 1784 not on Gomersal catalogue 1789 family: daughter of Benjamin Bradley (b 1700) and Mary (née Walker) (b 1708), granddaughter of Robert Bradley, and Thomas Walker, sister of Richard (b 1732), Henry (b 1733), Job (b 1735), Elizabeth (b 1737), Benjamin (b 1739), John (b 1741), William (b 1745), Mary (b 1747), Grace (b 1749) and John (b 1753), sister-in-law of Susanna (née Lee) (b 1736), aunt of John (b 1757), Richard (b 1760) and Elizabeth Bradley (b 1762) d 30.08.1809 aged 66 Fulneck, interred Fulneck by Br S T Benade 02.09.1809 grave 1242 - 1st section, 53rd row, 2nd grave from path

(G/F)x+^BROOK, Rachel (1744-1815) b 28.04.1744 Birstall occupation: sewer resided: Birstall 1744-1760 reception: baptized St Peter’s Church Birstall 13.05.1744 (OS) / 24.05.1744 (NS), received society Gomersal 30.08.1758, sisters’ house Fulneck 04.10.1760, received congregation Fulneck 11.05.1761, sacrament Fulneck 08.05.1762 family: daughter of John Brook (b 1709) and Alice (née Lord) (b 1712), granddaughter of William Brook and Hannah (née Birtby) (b 1687), and Samuel Lord, niece of Samuel Brook (b 1713) and Hannah (Brook, née Lord) (b 1708), sister of John (b 1740), Hannah (b 1742), Sarah (b 1748), Elizabeth (b 1750), Anna (b 1752), Samuel (b 1754) and Joshua (b 1756) d 16.11.1815 aged 71, interred Fulneck by Br C F Ramftler 20.11.1815 grave 1321 - 1st section, 57th row, 4th grave from path

(P/F)+^CALVERT, Martha (1743-1816) b 19.10.1743 Idle Parish of Calverley occupation: spinner reception: baptized St Wilfrid’s Church Calverley 06.11.1743 (OS) / 17.11.1743 (NS), received society Pudsey 1758, sisters’ house Fulneck 21.05.1759, received congregation Fulneck 13.11.1759, sacrament Fulneck 29.08.1761 family: daughter of Samuel Calvert (cordwainer of Idle) d 15.03.1816 aged 72, interred Fulneck by Br C F Ramftler 18.03.1816 grave 1327 - 1st section, 58th row, 3rd grave from path

event.desc: 16 January, 1746 27 January, 1747 left Lonndonn for Germany
recieved as acoluth and blessed as deaconessAnnehof Holland

person.note: (P/F/G)CENNICK Sarah (Sally) (1712-1770) b 12.06.1712 (OS) / 23.06.1712 (NS) Reading resided: London 1729, returned Reading 1733, Kingswood 1741, East Tytherton 1744-1747 reception: baptized Church of England, received society Fetter Lane May 1739, left London for Germany 16.01.1746 (OS) / 27.01.1747 (NS), sisters’ house Herrnhaag 1747, received congregation Herrnhaag 1747, confirmed Herrnhaag 1747, sacrament Herrnhaag January 1748, sisters’ house Pudsey May 1748, Disciple’s House London July 1750-1751, Annenhof Holland January 1759, Herrnhut 12.08.1759, returned England 13.10.1760 congregation office: intercessor Herrnhaag 1748, congregation servant Yorkshire 1748 church orders: received as acoluth and blessed as deaconess Annenhof Holland 24.05.1759 church service: single sisters’ choir servant and choir helper Yorkshire 1748 - July 1750, single sisters’ labourer Dublin 1751, single sisters’ labourer North of Ireland 1752-1759, single sisters’ labour Bedford 13.10.1760, Lampeter c 1762, assistant labourer among single sisters and great girls of country congregations based Gomersal 16.01.1765 retired sisters’ house Fulneck 20.11.1769 family: daughter of George Cennick and Anna, sister of John (b 1718) and Anna (Stone), sister-in-law of Jane (née Bryant, later Moore) (b 1721) and ? Stone, aunt of John Cennick Stone (b 1743), and Sarah (b 1749), Ann Grove Cennick (b 1751) and Elizabeth Hannah (Swertner) (b 1752) d 24.01.1770 aged 57 sisters’ house Fulneck, interred Fulneck by Br J Charlesworth 29.01.1770 grave 390 - 1st section, 16th row, 4th grave from path resited gravestone - right hand side of path to terrace, 4th stone from gate

(P/F/D)ssCLAGGETT, Elizabeth (Betty) (1715-1767) b 20.12.1715 (OS) / 31.12.1715 (NS) Castleford Yorkshire resided: Castleford 1715, London 1720, Castleford 1730, London 1734 - June 1742, October 1742 - July 1743, Fulneck settlement 29.09.1750 - 27.02.1753 reception: baptized All Saints’ Church Castleford 11.01.1715 (OS) / 22.01.1716 (NS), confirmed All Saints’ Church Castleford 1732, received society Fetter Lane 1740, received congregation London 25.12.1742 (OS) / 05.01.1743 (NS), sacrament London 05.02.1742 (OS) / 16.02.1743 (NS), left London for Yorkshire 24.06.1743 (OS) / 05.07.1743 (NS), sisters’ house Pudsey 24.07.1743 (OS) / 04.08.1743 (NS), sisters’ house Littlemoor 21.06.1748 (OS)/02.07.1748 (NS) - 03.05.1749 (OS)/14.05.1749 (NS), sisters’ house Fulneck 27.02.1753 church service: co-helper with single sisters Yorkshire 02.07.1743 (OS) / 13.07.1743 (NS), single sisters’ warden Yorkshire 16.08.1744 (OS) / 27.08.1744 (NS), single sisters’ labourer Yorkshire 05.10.1744 (OS) / 16.10.1744 (NS), resigned due to ill-health June 1748, single sisters’ warden Dukinfield 04.05.1749 (OS) / 15.05.1749 (NS) - 29.09.1750 family; daughter of Wiseman Claggett and Martha (née Clifton) (b 1691), sister of Susanna (b 1723), John Clifton (b 1725), Martha (b 1726), Ann (Shepley) (b 1728) and Catherine (b 1730), sister-in-law of Daniel Shepley (b 1721), aunt of John Benjamin (b 1767) and Anna Shepley (b 1770) d 12.08.1767 aged 51 sisters’ house Fulneck, interred Fulneck by Br B La Trobe 14.08.1767 grave 324 - 1st section, 12th row, 6th grave from path
